sen.j: 隈取（くまどり）とは、歌舞伎独特の化粧法のことである。
sen.e: Kumadori was the make up method unique to Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) play.
Kumadori was the make up method unique to Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) play.
Kumadori was the make up method unique to Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors) play.

sen.j: 市川團十郎 (初代)が、坂田金時 の息子である英雄坂田金平役の初舞台で紅と墨を用いて化粧したことが始まりと言われる。
sen.e: It supposedly started when Danjuro ICHIKAWA (first generation) put a make-up with lipstick and charcoal as the role of hero Kinpira SAKATA, who was the son of SAKATA no Kintoki.
It supposedly started when Danjuro ICHIKAWA (first generation) put a make-up with lipstick and charcoal as the role of hero Kinpira SAKATA, who was the son of SAKATA no Kintoki.
It supposedly started when Danjuro ICHIKAWA (first generation) put a make-up with lipstick and charcoal as the role of hero Kinpira SAKATA, who was the son of SAKATA no Kintoki.

sen.j: 中国古典劇の京劇にも瞼譜（れんぷ）と呼ばれる独特の隈取があり、両者には色彩によって個性を強調するなど共通点が多い。
sen.e: The classical Chinese play or Beijing opera also had unique kumadori called renpu and both had the similarity in stressing personality
The classical Chinese play or Beijing opera also had unique kumadori called renpu and both had the similarity in stressing personality
The classical Chinese play or Beijing opera also had unique kumadori called renpu and both had the similarity in stressing personality

sen.j: 隈取は初代の市川団十郎が浄瑠璃の人形にヒントを得て創作したものといわれ、顔の血管や筋肉を誇張するために描かれたもので、役柄により、施される隈取や色が異なる。
sen.e: Kumadori was supposedly created after the first generation Danjuro ICHIKAWA took a hint from dolls of Joruri (dramatic narrative chanted to a samisen accompaniment), and painted in order to stress the blood vessels and muscles of face, and Kumadori and color differed depending on the role.

Kumadori was supposedly created after the first generation Danjuro ICHIKAWA took a hint from dolls of Joruri (dramatic narrative chanted to a samisen accompaniment), and painted in order to stress the blood vessels and muscles of face, and Kumadori and color differed depending on the role.

Kumadori was supposedly created after the first generation Danjuro ICHIKAWA took a hint from dolls of Joruri (dramatic narrative chanted to a samisen accompaniment), and painted in order to stress the blood vessels and muscles of face, and Kumadori and color differed depending on the role.

sen.j: 最も荒々しい紅色の太くはっきりした「筋隈」やそれよりは大人しいが力強い「一本隈」は、共に若く正義感にあふれた英雄に用い、一つの劇で場面によって使い分けることもある。
sen.e: The 'ippon-guma' (one line red shadow of kabuki makeup) was strong but calmer than thick crimson 'sujikuma' (striking style of red facial make-up) was used for a hero who was both young and filled with strong morals and used apart depending on the scene in one play.

The 'ippon-guma' (one line red shadow of kabuki makeup) was strong but calmer than thick crimson 'sujikuma' (striking style of red facial make-up), and they were both used for a hero who was young and filled with strong morals and used separately depending on the scene in one play.
sen.cmt: 共に、の使い方が間違っているかと思います。
sen.e: The 'ippon-guma' (one line red shadow of kabuki makeup) was strong but calmer than thick crimson 'sujikuma' (striking style of red facial make-up), and they were both used for a hero who was young and filled with strong morals and used separately depending on the scene in one play.

sen.j: 菅原伝授手習鑑の梅王丸や暫の主人公が有名。
sen.e: Umeomaru of "Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami" (Sugawara's secrets of calligraphy) and the main character of Shibaraku were both famous examples.
Umeomaru of "Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami" (Sugawara's secrets of calligraphy) and the main character of Shibaraku were both famous examples.
Umeomaru of "Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami" (Sugawara's secrets of calligraphy) and the main character of Shibaraku were both famous examples.

sen.j: 同じ紅色系統でも水も滴るような美男子には下瞼に沿って紅を塗る「むきみ」を用いる。
sen.e: Mukimi' that painted crimson along the lower eyelid is used for beautiful male that seemed to resemble flowing water even if it contained the same crimson color.
Mukimi' that painted crimson along the lower eyelid is used for beautiful male that seemed to resemble flowing water even if it contained the same crimson color.
Mukimi' that painted crimson along the lower eyelid is used for beautiful male that seemed to resemble flowing water even if it contained the same crimson color.

sen.j: 「助六」などの曾我五郎時致が有名。
sen.e: SOGA no Goro Tokimune in 'Sukeroku' was the famous example.
SOGA no Goro Tokimune in 'Sukeroku' was the famous example.
SOGA no Goro Tokimune in 'Sukeroku' was the famous example.

sen.j: 黒・藍色系統では、「公家荒」と呼ばれる国家転覆を狙う大悪人（菅原伝授手習鑑の藤原時平）の隈や、嫉妬の鬼と化した女性の「般若隈」（道成寺の白拍子花子、その本性は清姫）、女妖怪に使う「鬼女隈」（紅葉狩の鬼女紅葉や戻橋の女に化けた鬼など）、荒れ狂う悪霊の怨念を表した「亡霊隈」（船弁慶の平知盛）など猛々しさは紅色の隈取に匹敵するが、冷酷であったり妖力を使う悪役のものである。
sen.e: Black and navy was used for the make-up of 'Kugeare' (wild kuge (noble)), who was the villain (FUJIWARA no Sihei of "Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami") that schemed to overthrow the government, female that turned into ogre with jealousy ('hannya-guma' (makeup like hannya, female demon) (Shirabyoshi (a women who play Shirabyoshi (Japanese traditional dance)) Hanako of "Musume Dojoji" (Young Woman) whose real name was Kiyohime (Princess Kiyo)), female monster 'kijo-kuma' (makeup like a female ogre) (female ogre that gathered autumn leaves or ogre that disguised itself as the female of Modori-bashi bridge, 'borei-guma' (ghost make-up) that expressed the grudge of crazed evil spirit (TAIRA no Tomomori of Funa Benkei) that roughness equaled that of crimson colored Kumadori, but used on villains who were cruel or used spiritual power.

Black and navy was used for the make-up of 'Kugeare' (wild kuge (noble)), who was the villain (FUJIWARA no Sihei of "Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami") that schemed to overthrow the government, female that turned into ogre with jealousy ('hannya-guma' (makeup like hannya, female demon) (Shirabyoshi (a women who play Shirabyoshi (Japanese traditional dance)) Hanako of "Musume Dojoji" (Young Woman) whose real name was Kiyohime (Princess Kiyo)), female monster 'kijo-kuma' (makeup like a female ogre) (female ogre that gathered autumn leaves or ogre that disguised itself as the female of Modori-bashi bridge, 'borei-guma' (ghost make-up) that expressed the grudge of crazed evil spirit (TAIRA no Tomomori of Funa Benkei) that roughness equaled that of crimson colored Kumadori, but used on villains who were cruel or used spiritual power.

Black and navy was used for the make-up of 'Kugeare' (wild kuge (noble)), who was the villain (FUJIWARA no Sihei of "Sugawara Denju Tenarai Kagami") that schemed to overthrow the government, female that turned into ogre with jealousy ('hannya-guma' (makeup like hannya, female demon) (Shirabyoshi (a women who play Shirabyoshi (Japanese traditional dance)) Hanako of "Musume Dojoji" (Young Woman) whose real name was Kiyohime (Princess Kiyo)), female monster 'kijo-kuma' (makeup like a female ogre) (female ogre that gathered autumn leaves or ogre that disguised itself as the female of Modori-bashi bridge, 'borei-guma' (ghost make-up) that expressed the grudge of crazed evil spirit (TAIRA no Tomomori of Funa Benkei) that roughness equaled that of crimson colored Kumadori, but used on villains who were cruel or used spiritual power.

sen.j: 代赫色（茶色）は土蜘蛛など、老獪で非情な役に用いられるが種類は少ない。
sen.e: 代赫色(brown) is used in ancient and cruel roles such as Tsuchigumo (The Demon Spider), but had less variety.
代赫色(brown) is used in ancient and cruel roles such as Tsuchigumo (The Demon Spider), but had less variety.
代赫色(brown) is used in ancient and cruel roles such as Tsuchigumo (The Demon Spider), but had less variety.

sen.j: 以上のように大体の型はあるものの、隈取は役者が自分で書き入れるものなので一人一人形が違う。
sen.e: As shown above, it had certain structure, but Kumadori was different for each individual since actor applied it himself.
As shown above, it had certain structure, but Kumadori was different for each individual since actor applied it himself.
As shown above, it had certain structure, but Kumadori was different for each individual since actor applied it himself.

sen.j: 歌舞伎のファンの中には楽屋に絹本を持ち込んで、役者に隈取を写し取ってもらってコレクションする人もいる。
sen.e: Some Kabuki fans brought kempon (a painting or calligraphy executed on silk) to the back stage and make actors to copy their own kumadori and make it into a collection.
Some Kabuki fans bring kempon (a painting or calligraphy executed on silk) to the back stage and make actors to copy their own kumadori and make it into their collection.
sen.cmt: bringは過去形ではないと思います。
sen.e: Some Kabuki fans bring kempon (a painting or calligraphy executed on silk) to the back stage and make actors to copy their own kumadori and make it into their collection.

sen.j: 歌舞伎の「隈取」は人間の顔かたちを想定したものなので基本的には人間にしか用いない（義経千本桜に登場する源九郎狐の「火炎隈」などもあるが動物の隈取というより神秘的な力を現す隈取）が、京劇の「瞼譜」は有名な孫悟空の隈取をはじめ動物役を想定した隈取が何種類も存在する。
sen.e: The 'Kumadori' of kabuki assumed the human face shape and generally used only for humans ('kaen-guma' (makeup like flames) of Genkuro Gitsune that appeared in Yoshitsune Senbonzakura (Yoshitsune and One Thousand Cherry Trees) represented not animal but spiritual power), but there were several kumadori that assumed the animal role starting with the Kumadori of Goku SON in 'renpu' of Chinese opera.

The 'Kumadori' of kabuki assumed the human face shape and generally used only for humans ('kaen-guma' (makeup like flames) of Genkuro Gitsune that appeared in Yoshitsune Senbonzakura (Yoshitsune and One Thousand Cherry Trees) represented not animal but spiritual power), but there were several kumadori that assumed the animal role starting with the Kumadori of Goku SON in 'renpu' of Chinese opera.

The 'Kumadori' of kabuki assumed the human face shape and generally used only for humans ('kaen-guma' (makeup like flames) of Genkuro Gitsune that appeared in Yoshitsune Senbonzakura (Yoshitsune and One Thousand Cherry Trees) represented not animal but spiritual power), but there were several kumadori that assumed the animal role starting with the Kumadori of Goku SON in 'renpu' of Chinese opera.

sen.j: 瞼譜を含め、アジアの舞台化粧は赤や黒のほかにも緑や黄色などが加わり、表情を強調するものというより異常性（プラスの意味にもマイナスの意味にも）を際立たせることに主眼が置かれ、そのルーツである仮面劇の仮面のような役割を果たす。
sen.e: Asian stage make-up including renpu used not only red and black but green and yellow to stress not the expression but focused in abnormality (in positive and negative definition) and functioned as a mask of a masquerade.

Asian stage make-up including renpu uses not only red and black but green and yellow to stress out not the expression, but focuses in on the abnormality (in positive and negative definition) and functions as a mask of a masquerade.
sen.cmt: 過去形ではないと思います。
sen.e: Asian stage make-up including renpu uses not only red and black but green and yellow to stress out not the expression, but focuses in on the abnormality (in positive and negative definition) and functions as a mask of a masquerade.

sen.j: 初代市川団十郎が坂田金平を主人公にした人形浄瑠璃の台本を舞台用にしたものを上演する際、人形からヒントを得て、紅と墨で描いたのが最初の隈取であった。
sen.e: The first Kumadori was done by first generation Danjuro ICHIKAWA after taking a hint from a doll to paint in crimson and charcoal in order to perform theatrical adaptation of a script of ningyo joruri (traditional Japanese puppet theater) as the main character Kinpira SAKATA.

The first Kumadori was done by first generation Danjuro ICHIKAWA after taking a hint from a doll to paint in crimson and charcoal in order to perform theatrical adaptation of a script of ningyo joruri (traditional Japanese puppet theater) as the main character Kinpira SAKATA.

The first Kumadori was done by first generation Danjuro ICHIKAWA after taking a hint from a doll to paint in crimson and charcoal in order to perform theatrical adaptation of a script of ningyo joruri (traditional Japanese puppet theater) as the main character Kinpira SAKATA.

sen.j: この時点での隈取は、派手な荒っぽいものであったと思われる。
sen.e: It is believed that Kumadori at this point was gaudy and rough.
It is believed that Kumadori at this point was gaudy and rough.
It is believed that Kumadori at this point was gaudy and rough.

sen.j: 真偽は定かではないが隈取の特徴である「ぼかし」の技法は、二代目市川団十郎が牡丹の花を観察して考案したものと言われ、以後の隈取はよりいっそう洗練されていくことになる。
sen.e: Although the validity is uncertain, but 'blur' technique unique to Kumadori was created by second generation Danjuro ICHIKAWA after observing the peony flower, and Kumadori became more refined with time since then.

Although the validity is uncertain, but 'blur' technique unique to Kumadori was created by second generation Danjuro ICHIKAWA after observing the peony flower, and Kumadori became more refined with time since then.

Although the validity is uncertain, but 'blur' technique unique to Kumadori was created by second generation Danjuro ICHIKAWA after observing the peony flower, and Kumadori became more refined with time since then.

sen.j: 江戸の荒事の中で隈取が発展する際に参考とされたのが、仁王像などに代表される仏像の誇張された筋肉表現と能面の洗練された表情の表現であった。
sen.e: Aragoto (Kabuki play featuring exaggerated posture, makeup, and costume) of Edo referred to Buddhist statue such as Nio Zo (statue of Deva Kings) that expressed muscles and refined facial expression of the noh mask.

Aragoto (Kabuki play featuring exaggerated posture, makeup, and costume) of Edo referred to Buddhist statue such as Nio Zo (statue of Deva Kings) that expressed muscles and refined facial expression of the noh mask.

Aragoto (Kabuki play featuring exaggerated posture, makeup, and costume) of Edo referred to Buddhist statue such as Nio Zo (statue of Deva Kings) that expressed muscles and refined facial expression of the noh mask.

sen.j: 一方、上方の和事を中心とした凝った筋書きの芝居の影響によって、隈取も荒々しいだけでなく色気を意識するようになる。
sen.e: On the other hand, Kumadori began to focus on allure by being influenced by play with a script that focused on love affairs of Kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka area).
On the other hand, Kumadori began to focus on allure by being influenced by play with a script that focused on love affairs of Kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka area).
On the other hand, Kumadori began to focus on allure by being influenced by play with a script that focused on love affairs of Kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka area).

sen.j: 歌舞伎の色男の代表格「助六」の主人公で「むきみ」の隈取も色っぽい花川戸助六は、現在こそ威勢のいい江戸男として知られるが、もともと上方歌舞伎出身のキャラクターである。
sen.e: Sukeroku HANAKAWADO, who was the main character of 'Sukeroku' that represented attractive Kabuki male figure had alluring Kumadori of 'Mukimi' is currently known as strong male of Edo, but was originally a character from Kabuki at Kamigata.

Sukeroku HANAKAWADO, who was the main character of 'Sukeroku' that represented attractive Kabuki male figure had alluring Kumadori of 'Mukimi' is currently known as strong male of Edo, but was originally a character from Kabuki at Kamigata.

Sukeroku HANAKAWADO, who was the main character of 'Sukeroku' that represented attractive Kabuki male figure had alluring Kumadori of 'Mukimi' is currently known as strong male of Edo, but was originally a character from Kabuki at Kamigata.

sen.j: 今日伝わる隈取の多くは九代目市川團十郎の高弟、市川新十郎により残された。
sen.e: Many Kumadori that still passed on today was left by Shinjuro ICHIKAWA, who was the master disciple of ninth Danjuro ICHIKAWA.
Many Kumadori that still passed on today was left by Shinjuro ICHIKAWA, who was the master disciple of ninth Danjuro ICHIKAWA.
Many Kumadori that still passed on today was left by Shinjuro ICHIKAWA, who was the master disciple of ninth Danjuro ICHIKAWA.

sen.j: 古今東西多くの隈取を熟知していた新十郎は、太田雅光の協力で研究書『歌舞伎隈取』を著した。
sen.e: Shinjuro, who knew well of Kumadori in all ages and countries wrote a research text "Kabuki Kumadori" with an assistant from Masamitsu OTA.
Shinjuro, who knew well of Kumadori in all ages and countries wrote a research text "Kabuki Kumadori" with an assistant from Masamitsu OTA.
Shinjuro, who knew well of Kumadori in all ages and countries wrote a research text "Kabuki Kumadori" with an assistant from Masamitsu OTA.

sen.j: 弟子の中村秀十郎の証言では、臨終時の新十郎の顔に隈が浮かび現れいくら洗っても消えなかったという。
sen.e: According to the words of Hidejuro NAKAMURA, 隈 (Kumadori) appeared on the face of dying Shinjuro and did not disappear despite washing many times.
According to the words of Hidejuro NAKAMURA, 隈 (Kumadori) appeared on the face of dying Shinjuro and did not disappear despite washing many times.
